data.title: do not use custom EGLContextFactory
data.body: it will crash on some devices

data.title: [ci skip][AUTO]: updating luabinding & jsbinding & cocos_file.json automatically
do not initialize VBO with big size for performance issue on some Android devices
data.body: detail information can refer to comments of modification

data.title: Allow customizing opacity of PageView indicator nodes
data.body:
Previously, the selected index opacity couldn't be changed, and the "deselected" indices were hardcoded to 30% opacity. This PR allows getting/setting the opacity for both.

Also, the "selected" index used to be simply placed on top of the deselected ones. This PR changes that, to hide the index that the "selected" index is currently overlapping. This helps avoid some visual artefacts and allows full control over the appearance of both selected and deselected states.

data.title: Crash in ContextFactory.createContext(Cocos2dxActivity.java)
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: cur v3 branch
- devices test on: android

It is report to my backstage. It happen in a lot devies. This is my code in ```Cocos2dxActivity.java```
```
    private static class ContextFactory implements GLSurfaceView.EGLContextFactory {

        private static int EGL_CONTEXT_CLIENT_VERSION = 0x3098;

        public EGLContext createContext(
            EGL10 egl, EGLDisplay display, EGLConfig eglConfig) {
            
            int[] attributes = {EGL_CONTEXT_CLIENT_VERSION, 2, EGL10.EGL_NONE };
            EGLContext context = egl.eglCreateContext(
                display, eglConfig, EGL10.EGL_NO_CONTEXT, attributes);

            return context;
        }
        public void destroyContext(EGL10 egl, EGLDisplay display, EGLContext context) {
            egl.eglDestroyContext(display, context);
        }
    }
```
This is one of the crash info.

crash info:
```
#87 GLThread 87
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

1 com.google.android.gles_jni.EGLImpl._eglCreateContext(Native Method)
--
2 com.google.android.gles_jni.EGLImpl.eglCreateContext(EGLImpl.java:54)
3 org.cocos2dx.lib.Cocos2dxActivity$ContextFactory.createContext(Cocos2dxActivity.java)
4 android.opengl.GLSurfaceView$EglHelper.start(GLSurfaceView.java:1030)
5 android.opengl.GLSurfaceView$GLThread.guardedRun(GLSurfaceView.java:1401)
6 android.opengl.GLSurfaceView$GLThread.run(GLSurfaceView.java:1240)
```
device logcat crash info:
```
07-05 06:17:20.827 1121 1121 D Cocos2dxActivity: model=xiaomi-1s
07-05 06:17:20.827 1121 1121 D Cocos2dxActivity: product=xiaomi
07-05 06:17:20.827 1121 1121 D Cocos2dxActivity: isEmulator=false
```
more logcat crash info:
```

07-05 06:17:20.955 1121 1135 D libEGL : Emulator without GPU support detected. Fallback to software renderer.
07-05 06:17:20.955 1121 1135 D libEGL : loaded /system/lib/egl/libGLES_android.so
07-05 06:17:20.955 1121 1135 E device_policy: Can not select an EGLConfig for rendering.
07-05 06:17:20.955 1121 1135 W dalvikvm: threadid=12: thread exiting with uncaught exception (group=0xa6132908)
```
[the whole complete logcat](https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/files/1141609/new.9.txt)

   - VS version:

This issue was reported at http://forum.cocos.com/t/httprequest-android/45905

data.title: More useful events and getters in UIScrollView
data.body: `SCROLLING_BEGAN, SCROLLING_ENDED` events for callbacks, `getScrolledPercentVertical(), getScrolledPercentHorizontal()` functions, and `bool isScrolling()` for whether the user is currently dragging the ScrollView to scroll it, and `bool isAutoScrolling()` for whether the ScrollView is currently scrolling because of a bounceback or inertia slowdown.

data.title: FPS down to 30 on Mac even in window mode
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: latest git version up to commit a7482b4bd13cdcc1875690b2bb6749bb329cdd87
- devices test on: Mac Mini
- developing environments
   - Xcode version: 8.3.2

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a new C++ project.
2. Compile and run a new C++ project.
3. The FPS stays at 30.

Note: also compiling `cpp-tests` will result in the same problem.

Error checking for missing files in Hello World example
Use cocos2d::Rect to avoid ambiguity
data.body:
This was causing an issue when compiling on OS X:
```
$PROJECT/cocos2d/cocos/editor-support/spine/SkeletonRenderer.cpp:320:1: error: reference to 'Rect'
      is ambiguous
Rect SkeletonRenderer::getBoundingBox () const {
^
/usr/include/MacTypes.h:550:41: note: candidate found by name lookup is 'Rect'
typedef struct Rect                     Rect;
                                        ^
$PROJECT/cocos2d/cocos/2d/CCSprite.h:45:7: note: candidate found by name lookup is 'cocos2d::Rect'
class Rect;
      ^
$PROJECT/cocos2d/cocos/editor-support/spine/SkeletonRenderer.cpp:347:9: error: reference to 'Rect'
      is ambiguous
        return Rect(position.x + minX, position.y + minY, maxX - minX, maxY - minY);
               ^
/usr/include/MacTypes.h:550:41: note: candidate found by name lookup is 'Rect'
typedef struct Rect                     Rect;
                                        ^
$PROJECT/cocos2d/cocos/2d/CCSprite.h:45:7: note: candidate found by name lookup is 'cocos2d::Rect'
class Rect;
      ^
2 errors generated.
make[2]: *** [cocos2d/cocos/CMakeFiles/cocos2dInternal.dir/editor-support/spine/SkeletonRenderer.cpp.o] Error 1
make[2]: *** Waiting for unfinished jobs....
make[1]: *** [cocos2d/cocos/CMakeFiles/cocos2dInternal.dir/all] Error 2
make: *** [all] Error 2
```

This patch fixes the issue for me on OSX, and I am able to compile and run https://github.com/olehermanse/MathGameCpp using `cmake` and `make`, without XCode.

data.title: Node small optimization
data.body:
This is the same optimization as in  https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/commit/5a5218982147bff4e571a4e75d34e76221abff43
Quick return in visit if it is not visible and has no children. Avoids calling processParentFlags, and director's pushMatrix and popMatrix
Thanks

data.title: fix invalid dt at start on iOS release mode
Fixed vsnprintf compatibility with vc12 and vc14
data.body: see reference: https://github.com/halx99/cocos2d-x/pull/30

data.title: setRotation not working for particles inside ParticleBatchNode
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.15.1
If my particles are inside Node, rotation works ok. But if parent is ParticleBatchNode, rotation is always 0.
Any ideas how to fix this? Thanks!

data.title: Fix issue #17654 so that slicing information is not lost when loading textures.
data.body:
This is a possible solution for #17654. 

It works for my requirements and mimics the behavior from versions before v3.14.

data.title: Check lastDisplayTime before calculating deltaTime.
data.body:
Fix issue which could generate invalid `dt` during the very first frame (after #17852 was merged).

This issue only happens on Release mode, given that on Debug mode we detect `big delta time` and set it to 1/60.

data.title: Do not define VERY_VERY_VERBOSE_LOGGING by default.
data.body: Remove VERY_VERY_VERBOSE_LOGGING from AudioPlayer/Cache so it can be enabled/disabled with proper preprocessor flag.

data.title: android subprojects won't compile
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.15.1
- developing environments
   - NDK version: bundled

Steps to Reproduce:

1. add any subproject as "compile project(':sub_project_name')" on build.gradle;
2. add "project(': sub_project_name').projectDir = new File(...)" on settings.gradle;
3. try to compile the project

This used to work. But now all subprojects stoped compiling.

data.title: compiling all cocos library for every android flavor
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.15.1

Steps to Reproduce:

1. create a project with multiple flavors
2. compile the project

issues:

1. We have a project with 21 different flavors, after the update to the version 3.15.1 it takes 4 hours to compile the project. Before the update it used to take about 20 minutes.
2. The build folder is 45 gigs now!!!

data.title: Poor Graphics Performance On Android devices with Exynos Processors
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.15
- devices test on: S6(have Exynos processor ), Sony Experia Z1 (have snapdragon processor) 
- developing environments
   - NDK version: r13b
   - Xcode version:
 

I have tested on many devices and have figured out that devices (in particular Galaxy S6) which have Exynos processors have very  bad graphics performance and results in low FPS and lagging animations. How can we increase performance on these devices?

thanks
